info: In German, the present tense (Präsens) is used to describe actions that are happening now, general truths, habitual actions, or actions in the near future. The conjugation of verbs in the present tense depends on the subject (ich, du, er/sie/es, wir, ihr, sie/Sie).

In German, the present tense (Präsens) is used to describe actions that are happening now, general truths, habitual actions, or actions in the near future. The conjugation of verbs in the present tense depends on the subject (ich, du, er/sie/es, wir, ihr, sie/Sie).
